abstract: One-day meeting of European foreign ministers in Brussels concludes with call for alliance against Islamic extremism with Europe and North African countries and other Muslim countries like Yemen; European Union plans to appoint security attaches at diplomatic missions to increase coordinated counterterrorism efforts.
lead_paragraph: European Union countries will assign security attachés at diplomatic missions overseas, and foreign ministers called for the establishment of a European system for exchanging passenger information.

byline.contributor: James Kanter contributed reporting from Brussels, and Niki Kitsantonis from Athens.
byline.original: By ANDREW HIGGINS and JAMES KANTER

snippet: European Union countries will assign security attachés at diplomatic missions overseas, and foreign ministers called for the establishment of a European system for exchanging passenger information.

headline.main: E.U. Urges Cooperation to Combat Terrorism
headline.print_headline: E.U. Urges Cooperation to Combat Terrorism
